content.description: Central Perk, Gary, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Would you like some more coffee, baby-doll?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m fine, thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, see, I can’t pull of baby-doll can I?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I’m gonna get some tea.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(Monica leaves and Chandler moves to talk to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hiya doin’ pumpkin?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nope. (Chandler nods in agreement.)
[Cut to Gary and Monica at the counter.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So it looks like it’s going really well for you two, huh?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I know, really well. In fact, I’m gonna ask Phoebe to move in with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: What do you, what do you think?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Tonight, but don’t say anything. Okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I’m so excited! { And I just can’t hide it ! I’m about to lose control and I think I like it ! Sorry, just couldn’t resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do not get her flowers. Okay? Because y’know, she cries when they die, and there’s the whole funeral…

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I’ll see you after work sweetie. (Kisses her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Bye!
(Gary exits and Monica rejoins them.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, what movie should we see?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Gary’s gonna ask you to move in with him!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I couldn’t hold it in any longer!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right, because it’s fast. Because, it’s so fast. It’s fast!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Relax! It’s Phoebe! Not you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Good for you Pheebs, way to go! (Breathes a sigh of relief)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, but it is fast. Isn’t it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohhhh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I like him a lot but I don’t think I’m ready for this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. I’ll just handle it—I’ll ask you to talk to him!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Me?! Why me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because you are so afraid of commitment! You talk to him, make him scared like you! Make him a…man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll try, but I’m not sure what good it would do, y’know? Because I’m a lot less afraid of commitment than I used to be.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her tea.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Still terrified, I’ll take care of it. No problem. (When Monica turns back he smiles and kisses her, when she turns away he nods that he’ll do it to Phoebe.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are playing catch with a little foam globe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, is uh, is Staten Island really an island?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh, that’s why they call it Staten Island .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohhh. I thought it was like Long Island.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Also an island.
content.parenthetical: he catches the ball and pauses, staring at Joey in disbelief

content.text: (The game resumes.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, what time is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! You realize that we’ve been throwing this ball, without dropping it, for like an hour?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn’t want to say anything ’cause I didn’t want to jinx it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! We are pretty good at this! Hey! We totally forgot about lunch!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I-I, I think that’s the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, you guys…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is Monica here?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right listen umm, I just bought something I’m not sure she’s gonna like it, and it’s gonna seem a little crazy, but this is something that I wanted since I was a little girl.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You bought Shawn Cassidy!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo! I wish! Okay, you ready?

content.speaker: Joey and Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay! (She goes and gets her surprise and when she returns with it, Ross stares in shock.) Check it out!

(Joey turns and looks at quite possibly one of the ugliest pets that you can possibly buy on the planet. Rachel has bought herself a hairless cat. Yep, a hairless cat! Joey and Ross start to get sick.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What-what is it?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What the hell is that?!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a, it’s a cat!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That , is not a cat! {I have to agree with Joey on this one.}

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes it is!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why is it inside out?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me! But this is a purebred, show-quality Sphinx cat!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How much did you pay for that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it was a little extravagant, but I a pretty good deal.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? How much?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: A thousand bucks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ON A CAT??!!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not a cat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right listen ball boys! My grandmother had one of these when I was a little girl and it was the sweetest thing! I mean it was so cute, it would sit in my lap and purr all day long, and I would drag a shoestring on the ground and he would chase it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Free cats do that too, y’know. {Which reminds me, if I might get a little political here, support your local animal shelter. Pet shops are not the place to buy dogs and cats from, you get a much better deal from the shelter, plus they probably won’t die on you in a week and a half. If you want a leash, go to the pet shop. If you want the dog for that leash, go to the shelter and save it’s life. Now back to regularly scheduled programming.}

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not a cat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ugh! Look you guys, I’m really excited about this! Okay? I don’t care what you think! I’m gonna go set up a little litter box for Mrs. Whiskerson. (They both glare at her.) Well, what am I gonna call her? Fluffy?!
(Rachel goes into the bathroom as the guys continue throwing the ball.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you wanna get something to eat or uh, do you wanna see how long we can throw this ball back and forth? Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, the ball thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross, wouldn’t it be great if we could go two straight hours without dropping it?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, yeah it would! Let’s do it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!
(They throw the ball back and forth once.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I have to pee. And Rachel’s in the bathroom!
[Cut to Chandler and Joey’s, Ross is seen throwing the ball into the bathroom, presumably where Joey is currently using the facilities.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, I didn’t think we were gonna make it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know! (Looks at the ball in his hands.) Don’t switch hands, okay?

content.description: [Scene: the 5th Precinct, Gary’s precinct, Chandler has come to talk to him about commitment. And as he’s walking through the door he notices a couple of “Ladies of the night” sitting there. (If you know what I mean.)]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey ladies! What are you in here for? (Laughs at his joke.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey Chandler, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Gary, I’m here to report a crime.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It is a crime that you and I don’t spend more time together.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I heard that you thinking about asking Phoebe to move in with you and I thought maybe, we should have a talk. Man to uh, me.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Sure. Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, are you crazy? Are you insane? If you live with Phoebe, you two are gonna be y’know, live-living together!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah, I-I considered that. I just know it would make me happy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean scared.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: No, I mean happy.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Scared? Happy?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Chandler, what-what are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I am trying to open your eyes, my man! Don’t you see, if you lived with Phoebe she’s always gonna be there. You’re gonna get home, she’s there. You go to bed, she’s there. You wake up and oh yes, she’s there!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I know! I can’t wait!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Were you’re parents happy, or something?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Listen Chandler, the way I see it is that I was lucky enough to find someone that I really love. I just—I wanna be around her as much as I can.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, y’know when you say it, it doesn’t sound so scary.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So you know what I’m talking about, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I think I do! Y’know what? You move in with her! You move in with her right now! Maybe I should in with Monica!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: No, it’s too soon for you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you’re right about that.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Joey are still playing catch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …now when they found the remains of the Mesozoic Mastodon they discovered what appeared to be the remains of a Paleozoic Amphibian in its jaws! How did it get there?!

{Y’know, sometimes I think the script writers through in a line like that to try to trip me up. But it won’t work. I’ll always have the last laugh! <manical_laugh.wav> Okay, so maybe I’m a little deluded, it’s probably just my spellchecker. But, I must admit I did get Mesozoic and Paleozoic on the first attempt. Yay me! Anyhoo…}

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe this should be more of a quiet game.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, I left my watch on the counter last night. (Goes to the counter) It was right here, where is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, come on, I’m-I’m late for work!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How do you know? You don’t have a watch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys, could you please just stop throwing the ball for one minute and just help me find it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I don’t know… Yeah, can’t do it.
(He throws it back to Ross, but it’s intercepted by Monica and the guys both scream in horror.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, whatever you do, do not drop that ball!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we haven’t dropped it in… (Looks to Ross.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 2 hours, 27 minutes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!
[Time lapse, Monica has joined in and is calling to get out of work.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I-I’m not gonna be able to make it into work today, I don’t feel very good. (Joey makes a high throw and Monica has to catch it way over her head.) (Not sounding sick) Yes!! (Realizes what she just did.) (Sounding sick again) Wow! Uh, for a second there I thought I was really better, but I’m not. (Hangs up and keeps throwing the ball.)
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Check it out! Almost 3 hours without droppin’ it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, wow! Congratulations, that’s quite a waste of time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You have scratches all over you, what happened? (Rachel’s arms are covered with scratches.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, it’s my cat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, I got a cat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t want a cat!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, don’t worry, it’s not a cat.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys this cat is nothing like my grandmother’s cat. I mean, it’s not sweet, it’s not cute, I even dragged that little string on the ground, and it just flipped out and scratched the hell out of me. And I swear, I know this sounds crazy, but every time this cat hisses at me I know it’s saying, “Rachel!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Doesn’t sound as crazy as paying a thousand dollars for a cat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me 300!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was gonna let you play with it.

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is drinking coffee as Chandler enters.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, did you talk to Gary about the moving in thing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes I did, and I think you should do it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: He’s a great guy, y’know? And he loves you a lot, you are a very lucky lady.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You are useless! Freaking out about commitment is the one thing you can do! The one thing! And you can’t even do that right! God!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry. (Pause) If you ask me, I’d move in with him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh!! God! (Gary enters and she sees him) Ooh! (To Chandler) Get out of here, good for nothing.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Gar!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hi sweetie. (Kisses her.) Hi, can I talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Okay. (They move to the couch.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: You look very pretty today.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks! Okay. (They sit down.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Here’s the thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Y’know I really want to move this relationship forward.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Because if you’re not moving forward, y’know you’re just moving backwards.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No that’s not true. If you’re not moving forward, you’re just staying still. And staying still is good. Watch this. (She stays still for a brief second.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I want you to move in with me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so sweet. But don’t you think it’s a little too soon? I mean there’s so much we don’t know about each other.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Oh. Oh-oh-okay, I get it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just—I don’t want us to jump into something we’re not ready for.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I really don’t want to mess up what we have. I’m just—I’m worried it’s gonna be a big mistake.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which is why my answer is yes!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh! (They hug.) I’m so…happy. (She’s not happy.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey, Ross, and Monica are still playing catch, with Chandler looking on. Joey throws the ball to Monica who catches it and whips it at Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica! Stop throwing it so hard! We’re on the same team!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Four hours? You guys have been doing this for four hours?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, let me in. (He jumps off of the counter to join in the game.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no! Don’t do it! Don’t!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He’s a dropper!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s right!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not a dropper!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s really a uh-uh three person game, y’know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s throwing and catching!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (He gently tosses the ball to Chandler who catches it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Oh! That’s so hard. (Starts to juggle the ball, but loses control and almost drops it and hands it to Monica.)
(Rachel enters with the “cat” and the chick and the duck start to get riled up.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa you guys, it’s not a cat!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my—Oh good God!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I give up you guys, I don’t know what I’m going to do with this thing!
content.parenthetical: she’s wearing an oven mitt to protect her hand

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Baking it didn’t help, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, why don’t you just take it back to where you got it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I tried! They won’t take her back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Maybe that’s because she’s a minion of the anti-Christ.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, why won’t they take it back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, they said would but they would only give me store credit. I mean, what am I going to do, get a thousand regular cats?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, if you want you can keep it at our place until you find out what to do with it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Mon that’s not the point. I’m out a thousand dollars, I’m all scratched up, and I’m stuck with this stupid cat that looks like a hand! (Storms out.)
(Monica sneezes.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, the cat’s made my eyes water! Don’t-don’t throw it to me! My vision’s been compromised!! (Quickly grabs a tissue to wipe her eyes.) Oh God! Okay. Okay. It’s okay. Man, that was close.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, you almost overreacted to something.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Gary
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: We have great news!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We’re moving in together! Isn’t it great! Yay!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Congratulations! Congrats!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know, I’m so excited!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So am I!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, you’re not more excited than I am! No way! I’m the most excited!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Okay, I’ll see you at the station later.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, yeah, I’ll see you later! Don’t forget about the moving in!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: All right.
(Phoebe closes the door behind him.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you’re moving in with him. What happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I couldn’t tell him no. He got so sad. Maybe it’ll be all right. I do really like him a lot and probably do it eventually anyway and plus, think of all the money I’ll save on stamps.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why, do you write him a lot?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I just heard when people live together, they split the cost of stamps. Don’t they?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! That’s right. Yeah-yeah! Yeah!
(Rachel enters with the cat, wearing the oven mitt, and startles Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, the oven mitts really freaked me out.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Hey, honey! Okay, so did you find any apartments? Anything in Brooklyn Heights?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, nothing.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Oh really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Nothing at all?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, as soon as something opens up we’ll move right in. Unless it doesn’t have a pool, I need a pool. (Turns away from him.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh!
(He takes her into one of those typical interrogation rooms you see on TV and in the movies. Which is really appropriate here, since this is a TV show. What are the odds of that?)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Take a seat. You okay? You feeling all right? (Closes the door and takes off his coat.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I feel great. ’Cause we’re moving in together.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: So you uh, you checked the paper for listings in Brooklyn Heights, right? You-you checked the Post ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, uh-huh, there was nothing. (Pause) Can I get some water?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: In a minute. You-you checked today’s Post ?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, yeah! Today’s.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: ’Cause uh, this is today’s Post (produces one from the other chair) and uh, these are the listings I found. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, two bedroom. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, one bedroom. (Points) Brooklyn Heights, (points) Brooklyn Heights, (points) Brooklyn Heights!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are these for rent! I thought people were just bragging!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Let me tell you what I think might be going on. (Phoebe looks down in shame.) No-no-no, don’t look at the table. Look at me. (Points to his eyes and she does so) Okay, I think somebody asked someone to move in with them. And I think someone said, “Yes” but now she’s having doubts because things are moving to fast for someone. Does that sound at all possible to you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Yes! Fine! I am someone! You want me to say it? I have doubts! (Pause) I’m sorry! (Puts her head down.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Phoebe…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Phoebe, it’s okay that you feel this way. I mean it is soon. And there’s a lot of things we don’t know about each other, and I just figure that everything I really like. And the things I don’t know, I get to learn about at someplace with both our names on the mailbox.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Sweethart, but none of that matters if it’s too soon for you. It’s fine! We don’t have to move in together. I just—I want you to be happy

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Living with you would make me happy.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Phoebe, you don’t have to say that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I really wanna live with you! I wanna move in with you!

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Definitely! Yes! Let’s live in an apartment that we both live in! (Hugs him.)

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Oh that’s great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wait, one sec. One sec. (Goes to the mirror) Hey you! Behind the glass! Who are you looking at! I’ve always wanted to say that when I was in one of these rooms, (sees the look on his face) which was never!

content.description: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel is trying to sell the cat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Show cat! Quality show cat! Show cat! (A woman approaches.)

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: Oh my God! What’s wrong with your baby?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not a baby! It’s a cat!

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: Eew! It’s creepy looking!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no! No! It’s actually—it’s very sweet. It’s very sweet. Look! (Goes to pet it and it hisses at her.) Yeah, do you want it?

content.speaker: Woman No. 1
content.text: No, I hate cats.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, so then what are you doing to me? Okay? Just get out of here! All right? Move on!
(Another woman approaches.)

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: Wow! What an unusual cat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Thank you! Exactly! You want it?

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: Maybe. I was thinking about getting a cat, I was just going to go to the shelter (Good for her) but… Okay, why not?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, terrific! That’ll be $2,000.

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, a thousand.

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: I thought you wanted to adopt your cat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I do, but you’re just gonna have to actually look at this as more of an investment than a cat.

content.speaker: Woman No. 2
content.text: Okay, yeah, I just wanted a cat. (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Obviously you know how to haggle, so I’m not gonna try and take you on. Okay? So $800 and I don’t call the cops because you’re robbing me blind! Blind! (Covers her eyes) Just take cat, leave the money, and run away! Run away! (Uncovers her eyes and sees that the woman has fled) Damnit! (To the cat) Cat, can’t you at least smile or something?! (The cat hisses at her again, it sounds like Rachel) Okay, did anybody just hear that? Anybody?
content.parenthetical: makes some unintelligible sound to stop her from leaving

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey, Ross, Monica, and now Chandler are still playing catch. The guys are exhausted and sitting around the room. Monica is still standing all pumped up and being hyper-competitive yet again. {Okay! We get it! She’s competitive!! Must we see all the time?!}]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m starving!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on guys! Suck it up! We’re closing in on ten hours! It’s gut-check time!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know who made you the boss? All right? We (Ross and him) invented this game!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please! I made this game what it is.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Not fun anymore?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m still hungry!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, there’s some pizza at my place, we can all eat with one hand right? Are you with me?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right! Let’s go! (Runs to the door.) Let’s go Team Monica! (The guys all stop and stare at her) All right, we can work out the name later.
[Cut to her apartment where Rachel is sitting at the table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel! What is your cat doing in one of my bowls!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not! I’m defrosting a chicken. (Pause) Oh, I uh sold Mrs. Whiskerson.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did you get your money back?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, 15 hundred dollars.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! You made a profit!

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: I just came for the red-velvet pillow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, there you go. (Hands over the pillow.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Thanks Rachel. And-and don’t forget you-you can come visit her anytime you want.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh good, great! I’ll-I’ll keep that in mind. (Turns and walks away.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Hey! So what is this? Some kind of snake or something?

content.description: Gary and Phoebe’s apartment, it’s morning and they’re both waking up in bed.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: I really like waking up with you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I like waking up with you too. (Looks out the window) Oh! It’s such a beautiful morning. (Some birds are singing outside the window) Oh, I can stay here all day.

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: That would be great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We could have breakfast in bed…

content.speaker: Gary
content.text: Wait, just a second.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (He grabs his gun and shoots the bird.) Oh! Oh no.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Hyper-competitive Monica, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are still playing catch. Monica is finally tiring while the rest of them are totally exhausted and virtually asleep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right! Come on Monica! Look alive! Come on, look alive!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good, you’re all up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe! It’s 6 o’clock in the morning! Why aren’t you at Gary’s?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s over.

content.speaker: All
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on! Gary’s such a great guy! Whatever the problem is, you can work it out!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He shot a bird!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh that is over!

content.speaker: All
content.text: That’s terrible! I’m sorry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, are you okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I’ll be alright.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey, here Pheebs. (He throws her the ball.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nah, I don’t feel like playing. (She sets the ball down on the table and everyone gasps.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s okay. It’s okay. Just pretend that it didn’t happen! Okay? No one needs to know! I mean, Phoebe’s not an official ballplayer! I mean, only official ballplayers can drop the ball!

content.speaker: All
content.text: All right. Okay. I’m starving! (They all get up, thus officially ending the game.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, honey, wanna get some breakfast?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Okay, let’s race! First one there wins! Ha-ha! (Runs out the door and everyone watches her leave.)
(Pause)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You guys wanna eat here?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah! As long as we’re here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man that was great! Huh? Can you believe how long we threw that ball around?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it is amazing it lasted that long.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. My arm is killing me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I meant with the dropper over here. (Points at Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, how did I get this reputation as a dropper? Okay? I’m anything but a dropper. (We see various scenes of him dropping a football, a mug of coffee, the phone, an apple, a Frisbee, a record, and the final scene has a ball bouncing off of his chest. I’m not going to describe them, you’ll have to see them.)
